A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: As a lifelong Star Wars fan\, I have had high hopes for the new iterations of the films. I saw \"A new Hope\" in the theater when I was six years old\, and SW has captured my imagination ever since. I can't even guess how many times I've watched the original trilogy. I eagerly awaited and saw the prequel trilogy. Like most fans\, I was disappointed in them. I was thrilled to see TFA. I rejoiced at how much I liked Rogue One. I was eager to see TJL and...I HATED it. What a huge let down. Everything that was set up in TFA was just thrown out the window. As a matter of fact\, everything that was set up since 1977 was thrown out the window. I don't have a problem refreshing ideas and stirring things up\, but at least have some respect for the original intent of the story. I was angry after seeing this film. This is the first time that I really don't care what happens next. Here's hoping the standalone Han Solo film is good\, otherwise I'll be content that ROTJ is the finale of the Skywalker saga.
